{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ultra high risk (UHR) for psychosis criteria is a tool used to identify individuals who are at a high risk of developing psychosis. The criteria take into account various factors such as genetic predisposition, early warning signs, and environmental factors. Given the complexity and multifactorial nature of psychosis, it is reasonable to assume that there are different levels of risk for transition to psychosis within the UHR criteria.", "answer_choice": "A"}
